channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Ascension says recent data breach affects over 430,000 patients
item.description: A data breach disclosed by Ascension, a private healthcare system in the US, affected over 430,000 patients, exposing personal and healthcare information. The breach was caused by a former business partner's vulnerability in third-party software used by the partner, which was exploited in a widespread Clop ransomware attack.

item.title: Google Chrome to use on-device AI to detect tech support scams
item.description: The article discusses Google's implementation of a new Chrome security feature that uses the Gemini Nano large-language model to detect and block tech support scams while browsing the web. This feature analyzes web pages in real-time to detect scam signals, and if malicious intent is confirmed, it displays a warning message informing the user of the risk.

item.title: Police dismantles botnet selling hacked routers as residential proxies
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various router models from Linksys and Cisco; CVE(s): None; Summary: A botnet infected thousands of routers worldwide, including older wireless internet routers, with malware since at least 2004. The compromised devices were used to build two networks of residential proxies (Anyproxy and 5socks) which were sold as proxy servers on the dark web, allowing unauthorized access to be sold for malicious activities such as ad fraud, DDoS attacks, brute forcing, or exploiting victim's data.

item.title: Cyberattackers Targeting IT Help Desks for Initial Breach
item.description: This article discusses a trend of cybercriminals impersonating IT support personnel, tax officials, or banking representatives to manipulate victims into granting access to critical systems. The attackers exploit psychological vulnerabilities and human tendencies to defer to authority figures, bypassing technical defenses.

item.title: New Stealthy .NET Malware Hiding Malicious Payloads Within Bitmap Resources
item.description: Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 researchers discovered a novel obfuscation method used by threat actors to conceal malware within bitmap resources of seemingly benign .NET applications. The method embeds malicious payloads in bitmap files, initiating a multi-stage infection chain that delivers destructive malware families such as Agent Tesla, Remcos RAT, and XLoader.

item.title: Hackers Weaponizing Facebook Ads to Deploy Multi-Stage Malware Attacks
item.description: A persistent malvertising campaign on Facebook has been uncovered, exploiting trust associated with major cryptocurrency exchanges to distribute multi-stage malware. The campaign uses advanced evasion techniques, mass brand impersonation, and user-tracking mechanisms to bypass conventional security defenses and target users with fake ads and accounts.

item.title: Threat Actors Target Job Seekers with Three New Unique Adversaries
item.description: A sharp rise in recruitment scams has been detected by Netcraft, driven by three distinct threat actors employing unique and highly technical strategies to exploit vulnerabilities in the job market. These scams have resulted in over $500 million in losses in the U.S. alone in 2023 and are likely to continue growing as economic pressures create fertile ground for cybercriminals. The threats involve advance fee fraud, phishing websites, and identity theft tactics.

item.title: BREAKING: 7,000-Device Proxy Botnet Using IoT, EoL Systems Dismantled in U.S. - Dutch Operation
item.description: The article discusses a joint law enforcement operation that dismantled a criminal proxy network powered by thousands of infected IoT and end-of-life devices. The botnet was used to provide anonymity to malicious actors, with users paying a monthly subscription fee for access to the infected routers.

item.title: OtterCookie v4 Adds VM Detection and Chrome, MetaMask Credential Theft Capabilities
item.description: The article discusses the Contagious Interview campaign, a North Korean threat actor group that uses updated versions of cross-platform malware called OtterCookie. The malware has capabilities to steal credentials from web browsers and other files, and has been found to incorporate new modules for stealing credentials from Google Chrome and MetaMask extension.

item.title: Chinese hackers behind attacks targeting SAP NetWeaver servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324; Summary: A maximum severity vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer allows unauthenticated attackers to upload malicious files, enabling remote code execution and potentially leading to complete system compromise. The vulnerability was exploited by a Chinese threat actor, with multiple customers' systems breached through unauthorized file uploads on SAP NetWeaver.

item.title: Scattered Spider Malware Targets Klaviyo, HubSpot, and Pure Storage Platforms
item.description: Scattered Spider, a notorious hacker collective, continues to actively target prominent services in 2025, including Klaviyo, HubSpot, and Pure Storage. Their tactics, techniques, and procedures have evolved with updated phishing kits and a new variant of the Spectre RAT designed for persistent access to compromised systems. The group's infrastructure choices, such as using dynamic DNS vendors and privacy-focused providers like Njalla, Virtuo, and Cloudflare, indicate a deliberate move toward operational stealth.

item.title: Germany takes down eXch cryptocurrency exchange, seizes servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVEs: None; Summary: The article reports on the seizure of a cryptocurrency exchange platform called eXch by German authorities due to alleged money laundering activities. The platform is suspected of facilitating transactions worth approximately $1.9 billion and is linked to the notorious North Korean hacking group "Lazarus".

item.title: Chinese Hackers Exploit SAP RCE Vulnerability to Deploy Supershell Backdoors
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer 7.x; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324; Summary: A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer 7.x allows attackers to upload malicious binaries, including web shells, granting full system takeover capabilities. The vulnerability is being actively exploited by a Chinese threat actor, tracked as Chaya_004, and can be used to disrupt operations, steal sensitive data, and violate regulatory requirements.

item.title: Hackers Target IT Admins by Poisoning SEO to Push Malware to Top Search Results
item.description: Cybercriminals are using Search Engine Optimization (SEO) poisoning techniques to trick IT administrators into downloading malicious software, which can lead to devastating consequences such as data exfiltration and ransomware. The attackers establish persistent access, evade detection by masquerading traffic over common ports, and systematically target mission-critical assets. To combat this, experts recommend a robust "Defense in Depth" approach, including hardening access to critical assets, deploying Endpoint Detection and Response solutions, and implementing application allow-listing.

item.title: New Mamona Ransomware Targets Windows Systems Using Abused Ping Command
item.description: Mamona is a newly discovered commodity ransomware strain that rapidly spreads across Windows systems. It employs a unique set of tactics, including exploiting the Windows "ping" command as a timing mechanism and operating entirely offline, making detection and response more difficult. The ransomware operates in "mute mode," executing all encryption and logic locally, and does not attempt to steal files.

item.title: Malicious Python Package Impersonates Discord Developers to Deploy Remote Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: discordpydebug; CVE(s): None; Summary: The 'discordpydebug' Python package was marketed as a debugging utility for Discord bot developers, but it actually contained a fully functional remote access trojan (RAT). Over 11,000 downloads were made before its malicious nature was exposed, putting thousands of systems at risk.

item.title: New Supply Chain Attack Compromises Popular npm Package with 45,000 Weekly Downloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WebScrapingAPI rand-user-agent; CVE(s): None; Summary: The npm package rand-user-agent has been targeted by an advanced supply chain attack, which embedded malicious code in several recent releases. The compromised package can be used to establish covert communication channels with command-and-control (C2) servers, upload files, and execute arbitrary shell commands, posing a severe risk of data theft and unauthorized control.

item.title: Threat Actors Leverage Multimedia Systems in Stealthy Vishing Attacks
item.description: Threat actors have begun exploiting multimedia systems, such as VoIP and streaming services, to orchestrate advanced voice phishing (vishing) attacks that integrate compromised platforms with social engineering tactics. These attacks exploit vulnerabilities in protocols like SIP and RTSP, and use deepfake technology to deceive victims, posing a significant challenge to organizations and individuals.

item.title: Hackers Exploit PDF Invoices to Target Windows, Linux, and macOS Systems
item.description: A sophisticated email campaign targets organizations in Spain, Italy, and Portugal, distributing a Remote Access Trojan (RAT) known as RATty, primarily affecting Windows systems but also posing a threat to Linux and macOS environments where the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is installed. The campaign uses legitimate Spanish email service provider, serviciodecorreo.es, and advanced evasion tactics to deliver malicious payloads.

item.title: Indirect Prompt Injection Exploits LLMs’ Lack of Informational Context
item.description: A new type of cyber threat, called "indirect prompt injection attacks," targets large language models (LLMs) by embedding malicious directives within external data sources. These attacks exploit LLMs' trust in uncurated content and can lead to data leaks, misinformation, and code injection.

item.title: FreeDrain Phishing Attack Targets Users to Steal Financial Login Credentials
item.description: The article exposes an industrial-scale cryptocurrency phishing operation called FreeDrain, which has been active since 2022. It leverages search engine optimization manipulation, free-tier web services, and intricate redirection techniques to target unsuspecting users of cryptocurrency wallets. The operation is believed to be based in the UTC+05:30 timezone (likely India) and operates on a standard 9-to-5 weekday schedule.

item.title: Initial Access Brokers Target Brazil Execs via NF-e Spam and Legit RMM Trials
item.description: A new campaign targeting Portuguese-speaking users in Brazil uses trial versions of commercial remote monitoring and management (RMM) software as a lure to trick users into clicking on malicious content hosted in Dropbox. The attack chain begins with spam emails claiming to originate from financial institutions or cell phone carriers, warning of overdue bills or outstanding payments.

item.title: Deploying AI Agents? Learn to Secure Them Before Hackers Strike Your Business
item.description: The article discusses the growing concern about the security risks associated with AI agents, highlighting potential threats such as data leaks, identity theft, and malicious misuse. It emphasizes the need for companies to ensure the secure use of AI agents, citing their ability to work with sensitive data and make real-time decisions.

item.title: Malicious npm Packages Infect 3,200+ Cursor Users With Backdoor, Steal Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm packages "sw-cur", "sw-cur1", and "aiide-cur"; CVE(s): None; Summary: Three malicious npm packages designed to target Apple macOS version of Cursor AI-powered source code editor steal user credentials, fetch encrypted payload, overwrite main.js file, and disable auto-updates.

item.title: Stealthy .NET Malware: Hiding Malicious Payloads as Bitmap Resources
item.description: Threat actors are using steganography within bitmap resources embedded in 32-bit .NET applications to hide malicious payloads, creating a multi-stage chain of extracting, deobfuscating, loading and executing secondary payloads (dynamic-link libraries) eventually detonating the final payload (executable). This technique is used to evade detection and successfully execute popular malware families such as Agent Tesla variants, XLoader, and Remcos RAT.

item.title: Beyond Vulnerability Management – Can You CVE What I CVE?
item.description: The article discusses the challenges of vulnerability management, highlighting the reactive nature of current approaches. It proposes a shift from "vulnerability management" to "Threat Mitigation," focusing on risk reduction rather than reacting to individual vulnerabilities. The authors introduce the Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) and demonstrate its application in prioritizing vulnerabilities. They also emphasize the importance of considering threat actors' skills, persistence, and scalability when assessing risk.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Host Header Injection to Breach Web Applications
item.description: A significant rise in web breaches has been reported due to Host Header Injection, a lesser-known technique. Hackers manipulate the HTTP Host header to compromise web applications, steal sensitive information, and manipulate website operations by injecting malicious values into the Host header, which can lead to exploits such as password reset poisoning, cache poisoning, and cross-site scripting.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Windows Remote Management to Evade Detection in AD Networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft WinRM; CVE(s): None; Summary: Attackers are exploiting Windows Remote Management (WinRM) to move laterally and evade detection across enterprise networks. They use stolen or brute-forced credentials, execute commands that appear as routine administrative tasks, and hide their activity by spawning fresh processes under the user's context.

item.title: Researchers Uncover Remote Code Execution Flaw in macOS – CVE-2024-44236
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS Scriptable Image Processing System (sips); CVE(s): CVE-2024-44236; Summary: A memory corruption vulnerability in sips allows arbitrary code execution via maliciously crafted ICC profile files. The flaw stems from improper validation of lutAToBType and lutBToAType tags, leading to out-of-bounds writes in heap memory that can be exploited by submitting a malformed ICC profile.

item.title: Apache ActiveMQ Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Induce DoS Condition
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache ActiveMQ; CVE(s): CVE-2024-XXXX; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Apache ActiveMQ allows attackers to exhaust system memory through specially crafted OpenWire commands, leading to denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. The flaw affects multiple legacy versions of the messaging platform and can be exploited by transmitting manipulated OpenWire packets containing excessively large buffer size values, forcing vulnerable brokers to allocate disproportionate memory resources.

item.title: Kaspersky Alerts on AI-Driven Slopsquatting as Emerging Supply Chain Threat
item.description: The article discusses a newly identified supply chain vulnerability called "slopsquatting" that emerges from the widespread adoption of AI-generated code. This phenomenon involves AI systems hallucinating non-existent software dependencies, which attackers can exploit by creating malicious packages with these phantom names.

item.title: UK Government to Shift Away from Passwords in New Security Move
item.description: The UK government plans to implement passkey technology across its digital services, aiming to enhance security and provide a more streamlined user experience. Passkeys are unique digital credentials linked to specific devices, eliminating the need for secondary verification codes sent via text message. This approach is expected to save several million pounds annually while strengthening national digital defenses against sophisticated cyber threats.

item.title: Europol Dismantles DDoS-for-Hire Network and Arrests Four Administrators
item.description: Four individuals in Poland were arrested for allegedly operating six DDoS-for-hire platforms, responsible for thousands of attacks between 2022 and 2025. The platforms featured user-friendly interfaces and allowed customers to launch attacks without technical expertise, with prices starting at €10. The operation, part of "Operation PowerOFF," was a major disruption to the commercial DDoS marketplace.

item.title: Play Ransomware Deployed in the Wild Exploiting Windows 0-Day Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29824; Summary: The Common Log File System (CLFS) driver in Windows contains a use-after-free condition that enables privilege escalation. Attackers exploited this vulnerability to deploy the Grixba infostealer, establish persistence mechanisms, and evade detection.

item.title: New Advanced Phishing Attack Exploits Discord to Target Crypto Users
item.description: Check Point Research has uncovered a sophisticated phishing campaign that leverages Discord to target cryptocurrency users. The attack redirects victims from legitimate Web3 websites to a fake Collab.Land bot and then to a phishing site, ultimately tricking them into signing malicious transactions. The campaign is linked to the notorious Inferno Drainer, which has continued operations despite publicly announcing its shutdown in late 2023.

item.title: Fedora Linux Joins the Windows Subsystem for Linux Officially
item.description: Fedora Linux is now available on the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), allowing users to seamlessly integrate Fedora's cutting-edge tools and development environment directly into Windows. The integration empowers developers to leverage Fedora's robust package management and software repositories while maintaining compatibility with Windows workflows.

item.title: Google Rolls Out On-Device AI Protections to Detect Scams in Chrome and Android
item.description: Google is rolling out AI-powered countermeasures to combat scams across Chrome, Search, and Android. The tech giant will use its Gemini Nano large language model (LLM) to improve Safe Browsing in Chrome 137 on desktops, detecting remote tech support scams and other types of schemes. Additionally, Google has enhanced its AI-powered scam detection systems, reducing deceptive pages by over 80% and government service impersonation schemes by over 70%.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Exploit SAP RCE Flaw CVE-2025-31324, Deploy Golang-Based SuperShell
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31324; Summary: A recently disclosed vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver allows attackers to achieve remote code execution (RCE) by uploading web shells through a susceptible "/developmentserver/metadatauploader" endpoint. The vulnerability, with a CVSS score of 10.0, has been exploited by multiple threat actors, including Chaya_004, since April 29, 2025.

item.title: FBI: End-of-life routers hacked for cybercrime proxy networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linksys and Cisco; CVE(s): None; Summary: The routers listed are vulnerable to exploitation by threat actors using publicly available exploits to inject persistent malware. Once compromised, the routers can be converted into proxies that route malicious traffic and are used for cybercrime-for-hire activities, cryptocurrency theft, and other illegal operations.

item.title: Cisco fixes max severity IOS XE flaw letting attackers hijack devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2025-20188; Summary: The Cisco IOS XE Software for Wireless LAN Controllers has a hard-coded JSON Web Token (JWT) vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to take over devices, allowing uploads of files, path traversal, and execution of arbitrary commands with root privileges.

item.title: Education giant Pearson hit by cyberattack exposing customer data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Pearson; CVE(s): None; Summary: Pearson suffered a cyberattack allowing threat actors to steal corporate data and customer information. The attack was carried out by compromising Pearson's developer environment through an exposed GitLab Personal Access Token (PAT) found in a public .git/config file, which gave attackers unauthorized access to internal repositories.

item.title: Supply chain attack hits npm package with 45,000 weekly downloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: rand-user-agent; CVE(s): None; Summary: The rand-user-agent package was compromised in a supply chain attack to inject obfuscated code that activates a remote access trojan (RAT) on the user's system. The malicious versions generate a hidden directory, open a persistent socket connection to the attacker's C2 server, and allow commands such as file uploads and shell execution.

item.title: Malicious PyPi package hides RAT malware, targets Discord devs since 2022
item.description: A malicious Python package named "discordpydebug" was discovered on the Python Package Index (PyPI) after over three years. The package, which masqueraded as an error logger utility, could be used to backdoor Discord developers' systems and provide attackers with data theft and remote code execution capabilities, downloaded over 11,000 times since its upload in March 2022.

item.title: DOGE software engineer’s computer infected by info-stealing malware
item.description: The article discusses potential security lapses by the Department of Governmental Employee (DOGE) and CISA, including public exposure of sensitive information due to weak credentials and operational security gaffes. Critics suggest that the leaks may be intentional, potentially benefiting specific individuals or groups.

item.title: The IT help desk kindly requests you read this newsletter
item.description: The article discusses the importance of being cautious when receiving instructions or requests from individuals claiming to be authorities, as attackers often impersonate authoritative figures to trick victims into taking actions that benefit the attackers. It also highlights the need for threat hunting and the use of different approaches to identify potential threats early on.

item.title: Critical Vulnerability in Ubiquiti UniFi Protect Camera Allows Remote Code Execution by Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ubiquiti; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23123, CVE-2025-23164; Summary: Critical vulnerabilities in UniFi Protect surveillance ecosystem allow attackers to hijack cameras, execute malicious code remotely, and maintain unauthorized access to video feeds. The most severe vulnerability (CVE-2025-23123) is a heap buffer overflow that can trigger remote code execution with full control over affected devices.

item.title: IXON VPN Client Vulnerability Allows Privilege Escalation for Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: IXON VPN Client; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26168, CVE-2025-26169; Summary: A critical security vulnerability in the IXON VPN client allows local privilege escalation attacks, enabling non-privileged users to gain root or SYSTEM-level access on Windows, Linux, and macOS systems. The flaw stems from improper handling of temporary configuration files, which can be exploited by replacing legitimate files with malicious versions containing arbitrary commands.

item.title: Cisco IOS Software SISF Vulnerability Could Enable Attackers to Launch DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CSCwk04230, CSCvq14413, CSCvo13585, CSCwj88828; Summary: The vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to cause denial of service (DoS) conditions by sending specifically crafted DHCPv6 packets to targeted devices with SISF enabled, forcing the device to reload and disrupting network connectivity.

item.title: Seamless AI Communication: Microsoft Azure Adopts Google’s A2A Protocol
item.description: This article discusses Microsoft's support for the Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol, an open standard enabling seamless communication between AI agents across platforms, clouds, and organizational boundaries. The goal is to address the growing demand for interoperable AI systems in enterprise environments, with potential applications in areas such as customer service escalation, IT incident resolution, and supply chain management.

item.title: Radware Cloud Web App Firewall Flaw Allows Attackers to Bypass Security Filters
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Radware Cloud Web Application Firewall (WAF); CVE(s): CVE-2024-56523, CVE-2024-56524; Summary: Two critical vulnerabilities in Radware's WAF allow attackers to bypass security filters and deliver malicious payloads to protected web applications. The first vulnerability exploits the WAF's failure to properly validate HTTP GET requests containing extraneous data, while the second vulnerability stems from improper input sanitization when processing requests containing non-alphanumeric characters.
